org.eclipse.keyple.plugin.stub

Interface StubPlugin

  • All Superinterfaces:
    org.eclipse.keyple.core.service.event.ObservablePlugin, org.eclipse.keyple.core.service.Plugin

    public interface StubPlugin
extends org.eclipse.keyple.core.service.event.ObservablePlugin
    This plugin allows to simulate card communication by creating @StubReaderImpl and @StubSmartCard. Plug a new StubReader with StubPlugin#plugStubReader and insert an implementation of your own of StubSmartCard to start simulation communication.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface org.eclipse.keyple.core.service.event.ObservablePlugin

        org.eclipse.keyple.core.service.event.ObservablePlugin.PluginObserver

    • Method Detail

      • plugStubReader

        void plugStubReader(java.lang.String name,
                    java.lang.Boolean synchronous)
        Plug a Stub Reader
        Parameters:
        name - : name of the created reader
        synchronous - : should the stubreader added synchronously (without waiting for the observation thread). A READER_CONNECTED event is raised in both cases
        Since:
        1.0

      • plugStubReader

        void plugStubReader(java.lang.String name,
                    boolean isContactless,
                    java.lang.Boolean synchronous)
        Plug a Stub Reader
        Parameters:
        name - : name of the created reader
        isContactless - : true if the created reader is contactless, false if not.
        synchronous - : should the stubreader added synchronously (without waiting for the observation thread). A READER_CONNECTED event is raised in both cases
        Since:
        1.0

      • plugStubReaders

        void plugStubReaders(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> names,
                     java.lang.Boolean synchronous)
        Plug a list of stub Reader at once
        Parameters:
        names - : names of readers to be connected
        synchronous - : should the stubreader be added synchronously (without waiting for the observation thread). A READER_CONNECTED event is raised in both cases
        Since:
        1.0

      • unplugStubReader

        void unplugStubReader(java.lang.String name,
                      java.lang.Boolean synchronous)
        Unplug a Stub Reader
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the reader
        synchronous - : should the stubreader be removed synchronously (without waiting for the observation thread). A READER_DISCONNECTED event is raised in both cases
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - in case of a reader exception
        Since:
        1.0

      • unplugStubReaders

        void unplugStubReaders(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> names,
                       java.lang.Boolean synchronous)
        Unplug a list of readers
        Parameters:
        names - : names of the reader to be unplugged
        synchronous - : should the stubreader removed synchronously (without waiting for the observation thread). A READER_DISCONNECTED event is raised in both cases
        Since:
        1.0

        java.lang.String getName()
